newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO seen discussed between $115-$118/T.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO seen discussed between $115-$118/T.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Thursday were expected to be discussed lower, between $115-$118 per tonne for 180-cst cargoes loading in November, traders said.
Bids/offers on Wednesday were indicated between $117-$119 per tonne on a free-on-board basis from Singapore.
Traders said weak crude prices were expected to keep prices under pressure.
"There are sufficient cargoes available to meet demand," a trader at a major oil company said. "I do not see any bullish factors in the near term."
Chinese enquiries were heard at $125 per tonne on a cost-and-freight basis to South China for cargoes arriving in November.
Residue stocks in Singapore showed a marginal drop of 294,000 barrels. Traders said current stocks levels were still high.
In the swaps market, November fuel oil was indicated lower at $116.50/$117.50, lower from $118-$118.50 quoted on Wednesday on crude losses.
